page.title: 15LOCAL CHURCHES
page.content: In the grounds of Mongewell Park {Carmel College}stands the Church of St John the Baptist.Although originally Norman,it has mostly fallen into ruin. The east end (chancel and altar)has been restored to form a tiny chapel. Services are occasionally held here in the summer.At the ruined west end is t{he tomb of Shute Barrington,who was Bishop of Durham and an owner of Mongewell House at the turn of the 19th century.In the tiny hamlet of Newnham Murren (parish of Crowmarsh )down a side road marked "private" off the A4074, there is an originally Norman church.There is a brass to Letitia Barnard dated 1593,which has a Civil War bullet.The key is at the nearby farmhouse.
